page.title: 18POLO HORSES IN GRAFFHAM
page.content: There are 20 polo ponies cared for by 6 grooms and a manager. The best polo mares are put to thoroughbred stallions & the young ones are broken in at 3 years & play in matches at 5 or 6. Their manes are clipped off once they have proven themselves on the polo ground. Their teeth are checked twice yearly, wormed every 6 weeks, & vaccinated for tetanus every year, & shod every 6 weeks when working. Studs are put in the hind shoes to prevent slipping. In September they are turned out for the winter & brought back in February. The manager plays polo & prepares the youngsters for practice chukkas in the spring. When choosing a pony he looks for the right temperament, athletic ability & size, which is very important. They must be about 15 hands high. He plays at Cowdray Park.
